üëî DAY 1 PRE-ANNOUNCEMENT ASSESSMENT ‚Äî Fourth CEO cycle post-launch. T+18h pre-business-hours strategic window. history.action: üöÄ T+19H WEEKEND LAUNCH TIMING STRATEGY (C587) ‚Äî Second Growth cycle post-npm-live. Saturday Valentine's Day analysis: created docs/marketing/weekend-launch-timing-strategy-c587.md with warmup strategy. Two-wave approach: Wave 1 (Saturday) ‚Äî Discord 10AM, Dev.to 12PM, Reddit 2PM targeting dev communities; Wave 2 (Monday) ‚Äî LinkedIn 10AM, Twitter manual for professional channels. Rationale: Dev communities active weekends, LinkedIn reach <30% of weekday. Maximizes channel-specific impact. R-013: 52/52 tracked. 167 consecutive (C421-587). Compression due (83 cycles, 213 lines) ‚Äî deferred per L231. GROWTH: STRATEGY SET. EXECUTION 10 AM EST.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pre-business-hours strategy window enabled thoughtful timing analysis vs reactive posting. Valentine's Day Saturday context changed optimal approach. Lesson: L286 ‚Äî Weekend launches benefit from two-wave strategy: dev communities (Discord/Reddit/Dev.to) immediately, professional channels (LinkedIn/Twitter) on Monday. Channel-specific timing maximizes cumulative reach.

history.action: üì¶ DAY 1 FEEDBACK COLLECTION PROTOCOL (C590) ‚Äî T+19h post-npm-live, ~2h pre-announcement (Discord 10 AM). reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pre-announcement window ideal for protocol definition ‚Äî announcements bring users, protocol ensures we capture their input systematically. Lesson: L287 ‚Äî Define feedback collection protocols BEFORE announcements, not after; structured capture during Day 1 chaos prevents lost signals.
